The 2032 Irish presidential election is scheduled to be held in October 2032, seven years after the 2025 Irish presidential election.
Under the Constitution of Ireland, the President serves a term of seven years and may hold office for a maximum of two terms. Candidates must be Irish citizens aged thirty-five or older and be nominated either by at least twenty members of the Oireachtas or by at least four local authorities.
The election will be conducted using instant-runoff voting (single transferable vote). If only one candidate is nominated, that candidate will be declared elected without a vote.
Catherine Connolly is the incumbent president, having served one term. She is eligible to seek re-election for a second term in 2032.
